message:
Ms. Emily:  Draw the light on the cherry. 

Me: There is no white paint Ms.

Ms. Emily: Wash you paint brush, dry it, use it to absorb the paint at the places where the light is. Make sure that you do this while the paint is still wet.

We are so used to getting something to complete a job, without realizing that in this case, the solution lies in taking something away.

They say, "If a person is sick, organize a gigantic party, and invite them to come."

Yes, big get together among loved ones, like engagement, baby shower, family reunion, buddies' house party, wedding, and ...birthday celebration (of course).

Time to support others in their milestones, open the appetite, and laugh silly. 

Yay!

post_title: Ailment is Blessing | 小病是福
message:
Never invite Ailment to your house. Nevertheless, when she drops by or even visits for a little while, just use the opportunity to slow down, reconnect with your loved ones, God or even yourself, refresh and recharge. 

Do I know what I am saying? Of course, through "lived experience".

We sometimes feel as if we have nothing more to give because we feel vulnerable, weak, and depleted, until we realize that there are others around who feel the same. 

Let's take one step at a time together, lending strength to each other, with the help of God, holding with our feeble limbs the hope that we are not going into the darkness, but coming through it and going into the light.

They say, As long as there is the "green mountain", there is firewood for what you need. Cheers!

Dear everyone, 

Thank you for your heartwarming birthday wishes. Each and everyone of you is a big part of my day. 

Can I bless you in the name of God, that you see God's presence in your going out and your coming in, in your ups and downs ( which I am afraid is part of life) in the next 12 months and beyond, and "take heart" no matter what. 

" ...Yet I will triumph in the Lord, I will rejoice in the God of my salvation. Yahweh my Lord is my strength. He makes my feet like those of a deer, and enables me to walk on mountain heights." 

( Bible)

Walking Together with God and you side by side and with much gratitude, 

Catherine
Thankful for past blessings, and grateful for blissful moments with my loved ones today:)

“Can a mother forget her nursing child? Can she feel no love for the child she has borne? But even if that were possible, I would not forget you! See, I have written your name on the palms of my hands.”

Isaiah 49:15-16 (NLT)

Hearing someone lamenting over their limitations in loving and providing for their children, and affirming the most incredible birthday gift that any parent would be excited about:  

loving and providing for our children, even when we are at our wit's end, with God's help, and...

experiencing God's unconditional and unstoppable love and provision for all of us.

post_title: They Say It's Fun to Watch the Mouth and the Nose Talk. Here's What I Saw Today
message:
A: I used to............

B: Thanks for sharing, but please tell me what you do now.

I love you both A and B in spite of your difference in language. Ha! Ha!

post_title: More Downtime in Our Own Backyard
message:
# Fresh bread made in the farm's own kitchen throughout the day. Ouch! Make sure that the hot off the oven loaf doesn't burn your tongue.

# Concert in the yard singing love lyrics like " when we were together", funny lyrics like " leave me alone", " we turned off the light, closed the curtain, and you mumbled all night", good news lyrics like " seeing the daybreak", " Jesus is there when you are troubled in spite of best efforts", and mixing productions of celebrities like Tina Turner with the artists' original production.

# Oh! Did I tell you that this is complimentary on their mosquito-free lawn, under a shade, on comfy chairs, and with easy access to all kinds of affordable savory, sweet, and organic food? 

# Talking about free stuff and food, their cross-generation staff really made us feel as if we were on someone's family farm: They talked about their facility and services with us in an informative precise manner, sliced and buttered the loaf of multigrain bread that we bought and wanted to enjoy during the concert at no extra cost, and did everything with a sunny smile. 

# Sculptures like bears, roosters, and all kinds of flowers blend in so harmoniously with the setting. 

Enjoy traveling afar but don't forget to leave space on your calendar to enjoy our local hidden gems like...Hy Hope Farm, Ashburn, Durham Region.

post_title: Birth, Death and Being Born Again
message: Born once, die twice. Born twice, die once. Critical formula. For details, listen to Skip Heitzig on Sunday Service.

Sent blessings to my Canadian friends of diverse backgrounds.

Celebrated blessings with my sweet family with rich ethno-racial descents. 

Enriched the abundant blessings by visiting an eatery flooded with world class Chinese food.

This is what the beauty of multiculturalism in Canada is about.

This is what enjoy each day the Lord has made is about.

A car not used is just a piece of archive.

A car with no fuel, no maintenance is a piece of junk. 

Same with humans.

Work hard. Play hard. Fully aware that both of them have a role in fulfilling one's destiny in God.

Inpiration: Morning walk in Downtown Copenhagen, Denmark

Seeing smiles on people's face,

Hearing about words of encouragement,

Smelling the spirit of connectedness, 

Tasting the sweetness of hope.

It is getting late, but nobody is in a hurry to leave. 

Time? Travelling? Consumption of energy? Late or no supper?  It is all worth it.

A: They never said no. We might as well continue to treat them like a milk cow. 

B: Don't give me anything. I don't want to owe you anything.

C: They give us tokens of appreciation for our help from time to time, which we receive gladly. I am also sharing some of my gifts from them with you. 

C, Thank you for your demonstration of mutuality.

“Although I am a typical loner in my daily life, my awareness of belonging to the invisible community of those who strive for truth, beauty, and justice has prevented me from feelings of isolation.”

~ Albert Einstein

Human: Dear Father God, Thank you for the blooming flowers in my backyard although I have not watered them properly.
God: You are welcome. Now you know why you sometimes asked for good weather, but it ended up raining:)

Adult child: Mom, just enjoy yourself around the house while we are at work. We take care of everything for you.
Elderly parent: I know you love me and do not want me to fall or get hurt. However, I feel trapped. I need to stay active, do things that I am still capable to do in spite of aging.

Husband: I give you everything. Why are you unhappy?
Wife: You give me what you want. Please ask me what I want.

Sad tears,

Mad tears, 

Glad tears.

They are God's gift for

Cleansing, 

Calming and

Celebrating. 

Thank you God.

Do I remember? Not really. 

But someone does. Thanks Bestie for remembering this special day for my family and friends like you. 

This means a lot to me.

Photos: Malmo, Sweden

A: Yes, we have made plans:)
B: I celebrate regardless: remembering each and every father figures in my life, past and present, old and young, and my Father God. 
C: Yes, let's do it.

Happy Father's Day weekend everyone!

Photos: Grand Rapids Airport

No matter how many times I told my lovely family and friends that this is a "work holiday", not a vacation, I still got a lot of messages saying "Enjoy!"

After all, I did enjoy this "holiday" a lot: meeting like minded people, contributing to important subject matters that I am passionate about, and learning from each other! 

Who said that Enjoyment only has one brother, namely, Vacation? He certainly has at least one other brother, namely, "Work Holiday".

Photos: Calvin University and Calvin Seminary, Grand Rapids, Michigan

Clarity is the child of calmness.
- Anonymous

Monday morning? 

Where do I start in tackling the mile long agenda? 

Here, in my mind, my heart, and my spirit!

In cloud nine + 

Grounded+

Smoke-free amidst the challenges associated with wild forest fire in Quebec ×

Learn not to take anything for granted

A: I work in a group home.
B: Me too. We help to deal with clients' day to day needs, as well as enhance their quality of life. 

Y: I am in congregate living.
Z: Me too. I appreciate how this living arrangement helps to give us a sense of community, and ample opportunities to support each other.

Yes, it did happen. 

Yes, it disrupted the flow you have worked hard to build and enjoy. 

Yes, you feel the pain, very profoundly. 

Yes, go back to the table, rearrange the seats, leave one not necessarily for them but for your fond and grateful memories of them, and make room for others at the door. 

Written close to the Special Remembrance Day in this family!

P.S. Thank you to those of you who sent your regards. It means a lot to us.

Photo: Street mural in Pisa, Italy

Listen with a third ear to the joy and pain underneath the words and behaviors.

Listen to oneself first before trying to do the same for other people.

Photos: Street Murals in Malmo, Sweden

post_title: Let Not Your Heart Be Troubled
message:
Let not your heart be troubled. (Jesus) 

How can an elephant put all their weight on a ball much lighter than they are? 

Many reasons, the key one is listen to their master's instructions and practice.

I sometimes wonder how I can alleviate myself of worries of different sorts. What I have found most helpful is listen to the message of our Triune God, and practice it! 

Would you join me in this today? Look up the rest of the above message in the Bible. Enjoy:)

post_title: "The Mountains Sing" by Nguyễn Phan Quế Mai
message:
The Mountains Sing is a novel embedded in the Vietnam War, from the perspective of the people of Vietnamese background. 

This novel triggers in me intergenerational experiences related to political upheavals, as well as the power of family harmony, kindness, and hope for healing from such experiences. 

This is a good read for anyone who values these issues and wants to explore them deeper.

post_title: Have I Told You Lately That I Love You?
message:
Have I told you lately that I love you? 

Songwriter: Scotty Wiseman, 1944

Being with...

Nature

Each other

Oneself 

The Creator of all

Pick whatever, and as many as you like.

I picked faith, hope, love. 

Source: Community Mural, Museum at Fenelon Falls, Ontario
The good life is here, in my own backyard. Contented:)

Listening to a celebrity talking about one parent's "hobby" of drinking a lot, and blaming the other parent for not helping to manage their spouse's "hobby". 

This sounds illogical of course. I am afraid that this kind of illogical practice is more common than one can imagine. 

Time for self-reflection eh?!

Some friends wondered about my excitement around the artwork titled "Resurrection". 

Here's it is: Do not look for the living in a place for the dead. Rejoice over the Resurrection of Jesus and its implication for people and things. Move on! 

Thoughts?

Photo: Galleria dell' Accademia, Florence

Another Sunday morning, chewing over her description about church life: It is mostly " internal consumption". She explained that the majority of the resources went to meeting the needs of its members, and not much left for others out there. 

What an alarming food for thought. Yes, there has got to be a balance! What can I, what can you do about this??

Struggling with the wish to appreciate this piece of artwork, until I found out that it is titled Resurrection. 

I got it now. Marvelous!

Unpacking from an almost never ending excursion, enjoying the overflowing greetings like "welcome back" and "how did the trip go", realizing that it is great to see places on my bucket list, but more so, engaging in relational experiences such as the following: 

Walking by the picturesque riverside at the Louisiana Museum of Modern Art, thinking that my beloved would have loved to sing and laugh at this memorable moment. As I was processing this thought , there was a warm light that shone in front of me, and disappeared within seconds. What I got was that God was consoling me with it. Yes, my beloved has moved on to his eternal home, and I can continue to travel in the presence of the eternal love of Him and my beloved.

When we are travelling, it is so easy to give ourselves excuses to skip Sunday worship as much as it is vital for our busy souls. Last Sunday, by the grace of God, I managed to attend worship. During the fellowship after the worship, the pastor's wife greeted me. When she found out that I am a tourist, she offered to be the guide in Copenhagen for us together with her hubby. We had a great time with each other.

Dear friends, Please be invited to a virtual party, celebrating my tour over strawberry cake and non alcoholic beer on the patio. Cheers!

post_title: The Voices of Flowers at Tivoli Garden, Copenhagen
message:
Flower A: You have stretched yourself outside of our fence. Be careful, the people passing by may kidnap you away from your family and home. 

Flower B: Yes, I enjoy our loving family and the comfort of our own home. However, I want to experience freedom. I feel being trapped behind the fence. 

They say, in critical moments, one may have to make a tough decision in picking only one of the following precious options:  life, love and freedom.

Dear friends, thoughts?

Kid A: I am quite sure that this is the way to let Doggie out of the gate. 
Kid B: Maybe we should try pushing instead of pulling the gate.
Kid A: It worked:)

Customer: Thank you for lending me your socket, but it doesn't fit with the outlet.
Receptionist: I am sorry. Please try this other one. 
Customer: It worked:)

Happy Mother's Day to...

all the mothers, 
sisters who have cared for others with maternal love,
brothers old and young who have been blessed by your mother figure, and 
our God who promised that he always remembers each and everyone of us although a mother may forget her baby.
The romantic and faithful Father God, who used the rainbow to sign His contract.
Please join me in enjoying the bird on the top of the 5 storey tall tree, and the marvelous self-satisfied Italian spirit.

Statue named Mercy and Wisdom. Wow! This really makes me think. You too eh:)

Source: Galleria dell' Accademia, Florence

Wake up in the chime of the bell at the tower of the cathedral in our neighborhood, step into the balcony dance in praise to our truine God for the day, listen to His words, pray for the people and things on our heart, look closely at the Italian decor around us, literally smell the roses, gobble up a healthy Mediterranean breakfast with cantaloupe, yogurt, cream cheese and bruschetta, ravioli wrapped in olive oil, zip on a cappuccino, curiously await what the day will bring, and head out clothed in faith, hope and love with our team.

post_title: Invitation To The Spirit of Harmony
message:
In Santa Lucia, a traditional folk song in Naples, a boatman invited his guests to enjoy his gondola. I am privileged to immerse in the spirit of harmony portrayed in the song first hand today, after dreaming about this spirit since I learnt it in grade 9 from my admirable teacher Mrs. King. 

Dear friends, Please be invited to experience with us the charm, smile, blessings and harmony of Santa Lucia in the virtual world. 

Here's the lyrics of this calming and celebratory song: 

The silver star twinkles above the sea,
the waves are gentle, the wind is favorable.
The silver star twinkles above the sea,
the waves are gentle, the wind is favorable.
Come onto my agile little boat,
Santa Lucia! Santa Lucia!
Come onto my agile little boat,
Santa Lucia! Santa Lucia!

With this so gentle wind
Oh how pleasant it is to be on the ship!
With this so gentle wind
Oh how pleasant it is to be on the ship!
All aboard passengers, come away!
Santa Lucia! Santa Lucia!
All aboard passengers, come away!
Santa Lucia! Santa Lucia!

Oh charming Naples, oh blessed ground,
where all creation wanted to smile!
Oh charming Naples, oh blessed ground,
where all creation wanted to smile!
You are harmony's empire!
Santa Lucia! Santa Lucia!
You are harmony's empire!
Santa Lucia! Santa Lucia!

Source: Erico Caruso, translated version of Neopolitan traditional song
Got more than what I ordered, and got charged accordingly(of course). I will monitor my calories on another day. Cherish the moment!

post_title: Where Are You God When We Are Disappointed?
message:
We had an amazing trip for 12.5 hours visiting Tuscany and its cultural and scenic landmarks yesterday. It rained intermittently and always when we enjoyed AC and felt cozy travelling in our coach. For a while, the tour guide announced that we would end the tour early because of the weather. 

This playful and anxious gal prayed silently, begging God to give us a nice surprise. After a while, the pouring rain stopped. The guide excitedly announced that the tour would continue as planned. 

It doesn't matter what this gal did, it was our Father God and His loving and almighty intervention.

Worshipping on this gorgeous Sunday in Florence, running into an elderly lady who tried to welcome us to the House of God and her city in her mother tongue. When we matched her friendly gesture with non verbal language, she got another elderly lady, who is just as nice as she is and joined the conversation in Italian, involved in the activity. Both ladies obviously thought that their teamwork would enhance the effectiveness of their initiative.

We did not get any concrete information from this small talk, but deeply appreciate these hospitable neighbors.

A beautiful City With 99 Cathedrals. Is this is: 

Barcelona? 
Cannes?
Lisbon? 
Lucca? 

What do you think?

Dear North Star, 

No matter how dark it is out there, when I see you, I know that you and your Father are here with me and guide me. 

Grazie!

My beloved used to celebrate his birthday with an egg. That is all he got growing up poor in times of transition and political turmoil.

Today, I celebrate his gift of life and love with a double portion of what he got: two poached eggs made in Itaian style, aka shakshuka.

Praise the Lord.

They say, an older person may rejuvenate into a kid again.

Yes, today is the day. Play day!

Day of cultural immersion and shopping

What did I get? 
Cashing in travelling dreams and sweet memories from the last visit; 
and weaving new dreams and new memories.

Stuck on the highway in a land excursion: 
* disgruntled about not making it to an UNESCO landmark? 
* enjoy the cute restroom at the roadside cafe with its neon light over the sink? 
* appreciate the tour guide's multiple efforts to keep everybody's spirit up, like getting us into the mood of doing flamingo dance on the bus, sharing his cross cultural love story, and his wish to be home tonight to enjoy his wife and baby before the latter's bedtime? 

Did I have a good day? Totally!

A: I am afraid of sunset and its symbolism around ending.
B: Try to enjoy its symbolism of rest and peace. 

C: I am afraid of losing my jewellery. 
D: Try to appreciate it while you have it.

E: Everything around here sucks.
F: Interesting. I like it so much around here that I just made arrangement to do a back to back cruise. I will stay on for another 16 days and go to Greece when you guys get off in Rome.

A: San Diego is one of the best places in the world.
B: In fact, I have lived there all my life, and am looking for a place that is different to move to. 

C: Azores is like the Hawaii of Europe. 
D: I am from Hawaii. I am making plans to move to the main island.

E: I told my family that I am done taking care of them. I need to move away. 
F: I am in the course of relocating to where my family is. We want to enjoy and help each other, while respecting each other's space.

Picasso: I want a table for 4. 
Host: Welcome to my restaurant. Dinner is on me. However, would you like to do me a small favor? 
Picasso: I will do what I can. 
Host:  Please draw something on a piece of napkin, and sign it.
Picasso: I only want to pay for my family's dinner. I am not sure if I want to pay for your new house. 

Ha! Ha!

On the topic of source again

The closer to the light, the brighter.

Get close to ...

Our Triune God, the source of light.

They say, If you have difficulty expressing your deep feelings, try using images. What images would you use?

Here are my images for today:)
Learning to make a distinction between sunset and sunrise, but always remember that no matter how the night goes, dawn always comes in its time.

眾裏尋他千百度，驀然面首，那人却在灯火闌珊處。（ 辛棄疾）

Searched for our beloved cherry 🌸 relentlessly since the first sign of spring at High Park, U of T Scarborough Campus, Thompson Memorial Park, Central Park, they did not show up, and decided to lay the search aside.

Nevertheless, they were there greeting us at Brook Park this morning when we least expected them.

What an annual reunion!

It is not where you came from, but where you are going that counts. 
(Ella Fitzgerald)

Your heritage is who you are. You cannot change it simply by being born somewhere.
(On A Night of A Thousand Stars by Andrea Yayura Clark) 

Paloma was born in New York. She felt more at home in Argentina than in New York. She felt conflicted about this. Franco shared the above thought with her. 

This gal certainly feels like a guest in New York when it took us 3 hours to reach the Penn Station instead of 30 minutes.

Unlike Franco, here's this gal's shallow silly thought: Whether at home or away from home, let's enjoy who we are and where we are!

An ordinary day on the subway

Why bother to talk about it? 

I saw ...
Someone with a guide dog, 
Someone with a walker, 
Someone clothed in tired brand name products, 
Someone sitting down and snoozing away. 

I saw life in each and every one of them.

Thankful for giving this ordinary gal another ordinary day, travelling with each and everyone of these ordinary people. 

Living is a blessing.

Happy Monday gift this morning. 

Green thumbs? Not my family. 

It just grew by itself. Thank God for doing what we cannot (even though this is easy for some of you, and you know who you are).

Best therapy for overthinking.

I usually wait patiently in April for May. 

This year, I am trying to enjoy both months for what each of them feature.

Stare at the shadow of darkness and lose heart, or 
Stare straight into the rising sun and move forward.

Satisfy us in the morning with Your faithful love, so that we may shout with joy and be glad all our days. (Psalm 90:14)

post_title: Learning A New Language: Flower Language
message:
My bestie told me about this flower called Peristeria Elata. It is an orchid from Brazil, which carries the Dove of Peace and only blossoms during Holy Week. It should be sent from person to person, sharing the blessings of the Holy Spirit and Divine Providence with the recipients of the flower.

I received two pots of these flowers as a group gift from some of my besties. Thank you. I love you besties. 

Dear friends, Can I invite you to open your hands to receive your blessings?

One ball, many ways of playing with it. 

One life, many ways of making it fulfilling.

One Trinity God, the Father, Son and Holy Spirit, many ways of expressing His grace, mercy and peace.

One tip on self-care: Enjoy all three!
Jesus is risen! REJOICE!!

Tied knots with one who...
Acquired a large following?Became a power house in one's professional practice? Gave the family financial comfort without them worrying? Sent flowers when they were better than a thousand words? 

That is not him. 

He was the faithful pastor of a humble ministry, lived from pay cheque to pay cheque, and the last words he said was " Please pray with the Prayer Group, asking God to help me remember that our life is in His hands. Thank you, the boys and everyone for everything you have done for me."

My beloved, I did what you asked. You are welcome.

They say, drama is like life. We are all actors.

No matter what scene in the life drama we are in, look up, and remember that our Creator and His creation always show up no matter what.

Product of a time of worship: Painting, reflecting on the meaning of the Holy Week, and it's implication for humankind.

Turning mourning into thanksgiving.
Go ahead and plan all we want, but leave sometime to enjoy the fruit of our planning.

Then:

Thief on the cross: Jesus remember me when you come into your kingdom. We deserve this ( death sentence ), but you (Jesus) have done nothing wrong.

Jesus: Father, forgive them for they don't know what they have done. Surely you (the thief)  will be with me in Paradise today. 

Now: 

Ms. Goodie Two Shoes: Jesus, I feel hurt as if I am put on the cross when I have done nothing wrong.

Jesus: You might not have done anything hurtful against them, but you have hurt my heart deeply when you did these other things. 

Ms. Goodie Two Shoes: Thank you my God and my Lord, BUT I don't know how to forgive as you have forgiven me.

Jesus: Look at the little ones around you. What do they do when they need help desperately?

TEAMWORK is not necessarily the absence of TROUBLES, but the ability to manage them TOGETHER. 

May you receive this gift my friends.

For behold, the winter is past; the rain is over and gone. The flowers appear on the earth, the time of singing has come, and the voice of the turtledove is heard in our land. —Song of Solomon 2:11-12

I lost something, couldn't find it in spite of best efforts, left the matter with God, and it showed up when I least expected it.

What is interesting is that this happened not just once, but twice this week. 

I don't have alzheimer's, not that I know of:) 

Dear friends, what do you think I need to learn from these repetitive experiences?

post_title: Canada Goose: Poster Boy of the Day
message:
Take a close look at a Canada goose, appreciate their monogamous spousal relationship, responsible parenting even at the cost of being judged for their aggressiveness in extreme situations, health conscious vegetarian diet, humble posture in spite of their beauty, and resilience to the harsh winter weather.

Draw them with full admiration while thanking them, my art teacher Mr. Pottery, and most of all, our Creator, and ...

Curb my urge to consume them over a feast or clothe myself in the warmest down feather jacket:)

At the end of dancing to O McDonald Has A Farm with a little pumpkin, I told them that I was tired. The little pumpkin called out the sweetest greeting "Ah Mah" (a.k.a. Grandma in Chinese), pointed at the easy chair next to their crib with a beaming smile, closed the door, and left the room.

At the end of the delightful visit, I gave everyone a gigantic hug. The little pumpkin blocked the door for getting out of the house until their parents suggested that they walk me to my car. The little pumpkin then opened the door, and reluctantly whispered "bye bye" with an enchanting smile while sitting on their parent's arms, as I waved at them with a blow kiss from the car.

I thank God for the little pumpkin's hospitality as well as the role models their parents set in loving me whole heartedly.

Dear friends,

You are invited to take a quick peek at this photo. What is one thing that catches your eye?

I see warmth, calmness and hope. Yeah!

This is not a test, but can be an easy tool for a self check-in.

A hybrid hibiscus-coconut tree for you sisters, and you brothers who have been richly blessed by the women in your life. 

I pay tribute to my mom who was far from being a feminist, but celebrated the day year after year, and nurtured the spirit of self appreciation and gender based equity in me and others whose life she touched.

Graduation Day today! I am still not Picasso. Not yet?! Surprise eh:) Thank you to my instructor Deborah for her empowering approach, which has made visual artwork fun, therapeutic and growth promoting. Thank you Deborah.

post_title: From the Eyes and Mouth of a Little One
message:
While playing with a little pumpkin, they suddenly stopped everything, stared at the window with wide open eyes, a curious look, followed immediately after with a contented smile and words of excitement in baby language. 

As I looked in the little pumpkin's direction, I realized that they were thrilled about the amazing scene outside the window the morning after what adults described as the worst snow thunder this winter. 

This little pumpkin woke up in me the beauty of worshipping the Creator with gratefulness and excitement. Thank you.

God always does things right and on time, but we people can never fully understand what He is doing. (Bible) 

I did not exactly fathom the depth of the above message until I closely observed a lovely little pumpkin's way of processing their routine around meals.

They cry, cry and cry until the bottle is in their mouth. 

We of course are aware that some babies need to do so in order to get the attention they need. However, most of them do not. 

How are we doing when we need help from a loving and well endowed Father God?

M: It must be hard living out here in the deep of winter.
Tree: I have found a way to survive and enjoy myself.
M: Don't you sometimes wish to be somewhere and doing something else instead?
Tree: (Sigh, and then smile) Yes, I did. However, by the time I finished packing, the birds have returned from the sunny south, and my little ones the new shoots are budding, and blooming into flowers and fruits in the blink of an eye.
M: (Speechless)

Watching the show Pressure, affirming that there is often a hero behind a hero.

This show is based on a real-life story about how the forever remembered General Eisenhower getting help from a meteorologist Dr. Stagg to decide the day that may put 350,000 lives at stake when he commanded a massive attack against the enemy during WWII, and masterminded the glorious D-Day in June 1944.

The hero behind the two heroes mentioned above is staff Kay Summersby who offered to visit Stagg's wife and new born baby experiencing life threatening complications at the hospital, as a way to give Stagg support to focus on his critical task in tracking the fast changing weather condition, and helping Eisenhower to decide the best time for the attack. In the process, she convinced Eisenhower, who initially denied her request for the visit, to give her endorsement by reminding Eisenhower that he himself had experienced similar issues in his family.

Summersby's empathy in action made her the hero of the heroes!

Watching this new movie on Netflix is like meeting up with a friend, and learning a few things from her:

1. We can have a world-class chef at home, but there is no taste in the food if it always comes with family verbal abuse at the dining table.
2. No matter how far we go, and how many people are around, loneliness can follow us or not. It is a mindset.
3. Sometimes, it feels as if people are alienated from each other because we are from different planets. Regardless, let's learn about each other and connect. 

Who is Chihiro? A former sex worker who decided to break free from her past, including her abusive family, works in a bento shop, enjoys her autonomy, and extends her care and support to the homeless, latch key kids, the sick and literally anyone she comes across, with her generous gifts of food and sunny smiles.

Here's this person who is supposed to have my act together, but Chihiro is my life coach today. Grateful.

People who 
drum with me excitedly over the dining table with chopsticks, 
coach me on filling my windshield fluid and cheer me on, 
spend Family Day together like a family,
make sure that I remember that today is garbage pick up, not recycling, 
show confidence in the value of my two cents worth, 
reconnect over messaging, 
laugh and cry with me over prayer time. 

Each of these gestures is like a petal, and they together make up a flower, and not just one, but bushes of flowers in my spiritual garden. I love you all!

“Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres. Love never fails.”

“We love because God first loved us.” 

-- Bible 

Different seasons, different joy.
Different music, different tune.
May you enjoy the love and music in this particular season of your life. 

Happy Family Day everyone!

Reading 6 minutes a day can reduce one's stress level by 68%.
( Dr. David Lewis)

Hmm!
Having fun with the gift of imagination in the deep of winter!
Night and day make no difference to Him, to you, to me, and every one of us. Smell the freshness in the air, feel the serenity, count the stars, and dance.

Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good. His faithful ❤️ endures forever. 

Happy Valentine's Day!

There is faith, hope, love, but the greatest is ❤️. - Bible 

They said, Grace is receiving what one does not deserve, and Mercy is not receiving the penalty that one deserves. 

Then, what is ❤️? 

Dear friends, May you enjoy ❤️ in a way that is meaningful for you.

post_title: Little Women and its Inspirations for a Not So Little Woman
message:
“I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship, ” said Amy March.
"Amy is like the lark she writes about, trying to get up among the clouds, but always dropping down into its nest again. Dear little girl! She’s so ambitious, but her heart is good and tender, and no matter how high she flies, she never will forget home, ’ said Beth March about her baby sister Amy March.

I understand that the novel Little Women is like an autobiography of the early life of the author Louisa May Alcott herself. I read this book when I was in the same stage of life as the sisters in the book. Out of the main characters, I identify best with Amy. She is not an independent writer like Jo, a loving provider like Meg, or a quiet musician like Beth. She is her own little woman, as unique as each of her older sisters is. She is an extroverted artist, full of passion, adventurous, resilient, and loyal to her family.

I also admire the young ladies’ mother Marmee. She faithfully played the role of a sole parent when her husband was away in the war. I believe that her wisdom and supportive approach to parenting have greatly helped each of the girls to be the best version of themselves.

This book is one of those that speaks to people in different stages of life and times in history. I credit this to its timeless, rich, and complex themes, especially love and death, war and peace, the conflict between personal ambition and family responsibilities, and the clash of cultures between Europe and America.

Reading this book for a second time after a lot of water has flown under the bridge brings back in me a lot of fussy warm feelings as a young woman as well as a mother. I am thankful that this book is around and I grow with it.

Where are you off to, my friend? 

Bon Voyage!

Your joy will overflow. (John 15:11)

My mom used to say, "When you have two calls, and you can only go to one, go to the one who may feel burdensome, and send regrets to the other one."

When it was -18 degree C, the snow was knee deep, and some people came to help, anyone would have a reason to turn their worries into joy.

Thank you, and you know who you are.

Parents will make your faithfulness known to children. 

(Isaiah 38)

Do not fear, for I will be with you.
Do not fear, for I am with you. 
You are precious in my sight, and honored, and I ❤️ you.

( Isaiah 43)

Your child decided to write to Santa now, so that he has ample time to get their gift ready. Between the two choices below, what is your advice for your child? Ask for something that they really want, or ask Santa himself (maybe Mrs. Claus too) to dwell with them? 

What is your answer to the above question my wise friends?
Give us our daily portion. Thank you.

post_title: Not a Professional Cake. An Aprofessional Cake
message: Thank you for the overflowing love that motivated me to prepare this aprofessional but yet most celebratory cake.

LIGHT HAS DAWNED. (Bible) 

Happy Lunar New Year everyone!

If you can sing, don't just sing in your shower. 
If you can write, don't just write diaries. 
If you can draw, don't just keep your artwork to yourself.
Enjoy, nurture and share your talents, your God given talents. 

---Anonymous

I got out of my house murmuring about the freezing cold, and ran into my neighbor S.

S: Hi Good morning Neighbour. 

Me: Hi Good morning S. It is cold eh.

S: Yes, but the sun is out. I am going for my walk.

Seeing S strolling away gracefully with her walker, I reminded myself to re- define the person who provides encouragement and the person who receives this precious gift. 

Dear friends, Between S and me, can you tell me who is who? Thank you.

Sad: 
Listening to an 85 year old celebrity with piles of awards and wealth saying that he is grateful for his achievements, but the best he can do now is to cope with his depression by waiting quietly for his death. 

Encouraged: 
Listening to our Lord God making an invitation to enjoy a new season in our life: "See! The winter is past; the rains are over and gone. Flowers appear on the earth; the season of singing has come, and the cooing of doves is heard in our land. The fig tree forms its early fruit;  the blossoming vines spread their fragrance. Arise, come, my darling;  my beautiful one, come with me.” (Song of Songs) 

This is not about self-hypnosis or the prosperity gospel. It is about grounding in the vision and experience of wellness in our transitions. 

Dear friends, Warmest wishes and prayers for those of you who are going through transitions now, right now.

Reading the news today about succession planning among the world's richest people as well as Lisa Marie Presley's passing, I asked myself what I can do about relevant subject matters as a humble but happy parent and grandparent.

Resolution: My faith, hope and love in our Lord Jesus and humankind.

What is the best thing to do at the end of a busy but fruitful day?

Here's mine: 

Wish the people and things on our minds sweet dreams. 

Enjoy the beauty of silence.

Gently close our eyes with gratitude in our hearts, a smile on our faces, and whisper Amen.

It is senseless that you work hard from morning till night, fearing that you will starve to death; for God wants His loved ones to get proper rest. (Psalm 127:2)

Some of us may work 247 due to the sheer need for survival and against our wish. Others may work just as hard not necessarily due to fear of starvation, but because of other fears.

It is such a relief to sleep and/or rest in our own way without fear.

Woke up this Saturday morning at dawn, and got excited about the idea of getting a full day to get caught up on things from the to-do list. However, my body was clearly protesting about this early rise through her suggestion about re-routing to dreamland. 

I then realized that we sometimes do not just work seven days straight, but fifteen days non-stop. 

End of story: I am going to take the day off. Instead of going fishing, I am going to do something similar?!

Dear friends, I value your advice on what to do on a real day off.

My race is completed. I am receiving the most glorious wreath.
-- Apostle Paul, Bible

I thought I was smart in following my beloved's wish to host a Thanksgiving event to show gratitude to God and the people in his life. I did this through the Celebration of Life full of festive events and fond memories of him.

I did not realize that God also wanted to top this off by acknowledging my beloved's humble yet faithful service before Him until I saw the wreath our lovely son and daughter-in-law used to honor him at their wedding. This is amazing. The wedding was in Greece where a wreath was given to the winner of every Olympian marathon run.

I can choose to feel envious of my beloved and melancholy at the same time. However, I aspired to continue with another Olympic game, that is, a relay race, that I started with my beloved and our team in real life, cheer each other in the course of completing our respective legs of the race, and celebrate together as a winning team at the finish line. 

I am not in a hurry to get to the finish line, but I will run with intentionality. 

Dear friends, Would you either join our winning team or be our cheerleaders? Let's chant: Hands on your hips, a smile on your lips, a spirit in your heart, we're ready to start!
Bundles of warmest wishes and prayers for each and everyone. Take the blessings on your heart from the pictures, and enjoy!

Go With The Float is a very inspiring Chinese tv drama on embracing transitions throughout the life cycle for young and old, such as but not limited to issues around education, employment, fertility, health, housing, loyalty, parenting...

One of the many inspirations I got from this drama is that we all have a portion of transitions as we live and breathe. It would be unrealistic to think that we will be excused from this human condition. However, what matters is how we prepare ourselves for this condition and use it as fuel for self-discovery, purposefully and gratefully spending each day. 

Here's a sample of "energy generators " from my loved ones for my Voyage. 

My friends, Let's get ready for our Voyage in 2023 and share lights with each other when they grow dim.

Enjoying some quiet time together, creating artwork for each other, sharing warm wishes.

Dear friends, Little grandson is sending you hugs on behalf of the family through his handprint as you look at it. God love you and so do we!

Merry Christmas!
Peace with 
God and mankind in Faith,Hope, and Love!

post_title: Prayer for Light on a Pre-Christmas Stormy Day
message:
My friends, Would you take a moment out of your busy schedule and say this prayer for individuals, families and communities that are hurting? Thank you. 

God of heaven and earth,
in this drama of Advent and Christmas,
our lines do not follow the expected script.
Some of us are hurting from the inside out
as much as others are celebrating their joy.
Amid talk about fulfillment,
loss looms large.

Remind us that you come to us
as the Incarnate Christ
whether we have mustered the strength to light a candle
or decided to sit in darkness.
You reach out to us
whether we are singing jubilantly
or weeping uncontrollably.

We wait for you to come to us
where we are,
as we are--
numb,
grieving,
fragile,
coping,
out-of-sync with the season’s songs.

Punch a hole in the darkness
that swallows us
to let in a glimmer of hope.

Sometimes a pinprick of light is all we need. 

Source: Darkness written by Sharlande Sledge c1999 Smyth & Helwys Publishing, Inc.

I thought I was being a good host by asking all of the guests to come prepared to facilitate an activity of their choice. Did that happen? Not at all.

We had better things to do. Over our pot luck lunch, my lovely guests started to talk about things and people on their heart.

Thank you to each and everyone of my friends for the gifts of spontaneity and connectivity.

Happy?  Heartwarming? Heartbreaking?

Learn to filter out the negatives, pack the positives, label them as gifts of joy from this season, bundle them up, and deliver them to the new year.

" Put our past behind us, press forward towards our finishing line (and be a winner in the marathon race of life by the grace of God)." (Bible)

Guillermo del Toro's "Pinocchio" is a stop-motion animated musical fantasy film released just this month. It is based on the 1883 Italian novel The Adventures of Pinocchio by Carlo Collodi. It reimagines the story in 1930s Fascist Italy as a story of love and disobedience as Pinocchio struggles to live up to his father Geppetto's expectations, and learning the true meaning of life.

This production bears multiple key messages, but here's what I got out of it myself: 
1. Parents need to be careful how they process their frustrations: Geppetto once commented that Pinocchio is a burden and out of his own frustration. In order to make his father happy, Pinocchio stopped going to school, and started working, hoping that being a wage earner would resolve his father's concern. 
2. Children need to develop into the best they can be and be who they are: Geppetto wanted Pinocchio to be a replacement for his other son Carlo who died 20 years ago during an inadvertent aerial bombardment in the Great War. This has made life very difficult for Pinocchio. 
3. Never underestimate children's pure love: Pinocchio came across as being rebellious throughout the film. However, when Geppetto was in a life-threatening situation, Pinocchio gave up his status of being immortal in order to save Geppetto's life. 
4. The faith community needs to respect diversity issues: Pinocchio was made from wood by Geppetto who is a woodcarver. He went to church joyfully with Geppetto. However, the pastor together with the congregation demanded Geppetto to go home with Pinocchio immediately simply because he did not look like one of them. 

Yes, Pinocchio's story I am afraid is a mirror for us parents, grandparents, and faith community leaders to reflect on our rights and wrongs. Let's pray to God to give us the courage to face our own mistakes, and take corrective actions by His grace.

On the cruise, I developed a fond connection with the pilot boat which guided our cruise ship into each of the ports. 

In the beginning, I got nervous when the pilot boat disappeared suddenly. Over time, I learned that it was still there, but it had to move back and forth around the different sides of the ship in order to steer the latter to get into the port safely. 

I then realized that my nervousness is not about the boat. It is about the experience of loss that stirred up in me. 

On the last day of the voyage, I practiced saying goodbye: Wearing a glowing smile, waving at the pilot boat in the gentle breeze with my favorite burgundy cotton scarf, sending streams of blow kisses in the air, and cleansing my soul with grateful tears.

Morning Has Broken

Woke up by sunlight, murmuring that I have missed my favorite activity "watching sunrise". In the midst of my regretful sighs, I went to the balcony to get a fresh breath of air, and realized that the sunlight that woke me up was just the first ray of the morning light, a prelude that excitedly and quietly announcing the momentary arrival of the sun itself. 

Yeah! I did watch the sunrise this morning afterall!

Just winding down from another day of busyness when the moon is singing and dancing above the tall and handsome maple tree at the yard. All of a sudden, I realized that I am a new single parent, not so much to take care of our lovely children, but the joint functions that the two of us used to carry together, on top of my own ongoing engagements. I am grateful for the opportunity to help make a difference, but also need prayers for striking a balance. Thank you.

What is grief and the place of gratitude in grief? 

Looking at the bright colorful beauty of the backyard on this sunny autumn Sunday afternoon, 
Seeing him mowing the lawn, Hearing him shouting excitedly like a child " I did the yard work nicely. Let's go out for a treat now" , 
Wondering what this home will be like for my family when it is my time to join him in eternity, 
Imagining him walking through the front door as if he just came home from an out-of-country mission trip, and the celebration of life was for someone else, not him, and
Most of all, thank God for our life together and shared hopes in Christ.

Feeling relieved when releasing a gigantic backpack from our shoulders after lugging it around for a while as we travel?

We frequently hide our pain from those closest to us. It is hard to open up. However, unraveling our pain with them is like what we do with the backpack mentioned above.

post_title: Message of Mr. Ocean and Ms. Star
message:
Staring at the sunrise literally from the middle of the roaring sea, asking God to quiet my mind and heart, and He did: 

"I hold the Oceans in My hand and call the Stars by name.

I can certainly handle anything on earth when you call on Me."

A gift of wisdom from our Jamaican friends: 

“One God! One Aim! One Destiny!” ( Marcus Garvey on unity and solidarity among black people) 

 “One love, one heart, let’s get together and feel alright. ” ( Bob Marley on harmony among people of different races) 

May we learn from these two precious people, and uphold their different yet complementary philosophies on harmony.

The saying "ya mon" or "no problem" in Jamaica reminded me of the Bible's description of how the prophet Elisha helped his panicky servant to deal with the fear of impending persecution. He prayed that God would open his servant's eyes to see His angel army that protected them and outnumbered their foes, and God graciously answered his prayer. 

To genuinely experience the status of "no problem", I am learning to shift my mindset: It is unrealistic to strive towards being problem free, but we can ask our Lord God to open our eyes when we are in distress like how He did it for Elisha and his servant. 

Ya mon!

post_title: Being the Love of the Love of My Life
message:
Make a wish (about one's relationship)? I already got it, i.e. the wish has already come true. 

---Jennifer Lopez and Owen Wilson in the movie "Marry Me"

If that is you, treasure!

Chat #1. 

C: Can I change my room to the same floor as my family?
Staff R: We have nothing available on your family's floor, but you may need to pay extra for this special request if a room becomes available. 

Chat #2. 
C: Can I change my room to the same floor as my family?
Staff G: This ship is fully booked. I can put in a request for you if you want.

Chat #3. 
C:  Can I change my room to the same floor as my family?
Staff H: We can switch your room as you requested, on condition that you agree to accept a complimentary upgrade from a room with a balcony to a suite with a balcony. Yes, to be clear, you will not be charged extra. 

If this is not a miracle, what is?

Version 1

Carrying unfinished business from the day before, bruised, broken, burdensome, weary, wondering when this prolonged daily cycle of suffering will end. 

Version 2. 

Marveling at the beacon of light at dawn, drinking an overflowing cup of fresh air, eating hope, comfort and strength for breakfast prepared by the Master Chef of the brand name Universe. Dressed in His layered and compounding truths, strolling into the day light-hearted and confident.

9 p.m. Came into a hotel, was advised to put a piece of heavy furniture against the door in case an unwelcome visitor comes to the door in the middle of the night in this quiet and remote place.

12 midnight The music from the dated furnace and fridge kept waking up this drowsy soul intermittently. 

1. 23 a.m. Someone yelled next door over the phone, complaining that their request to talk with the supervisor about the shuttle bus service to the terminal was ignored.

2.30 a.m. Two people raced through the hallway outside and screamed in foul language.

4.38 a.m. Someone shouted in a tender but loud voice from the street downstairs, telling their honey that they were waiting for them down there.

5.01 a.m. An alarm from one of the neighboring rooms rang, and kept ringing FOREVER.

6.30  a.m. My own alarm rang. I thanked it for doing its job right on time, but jokingly told it that I already got a lot of help to wake me up before it reported for duty this morning.

7 a.m. Wide awake, giggling silly, rejoicing over the roof over our head for this pre- Black Friday special at 79% off its original price (Wow!).

Lesson learnt: Home Sweet Home!

This is the name of a children's movie, which talks about a young girl Lucky's experience of befriending a young wild horse Spirit and working with him and Lucky's friends and father in rescuing Spirit's family from being kidnapped and sold by greedy horse traders. In the process, Lucky developed appreciation for the value of family and came closer to his grieving and under- involved father.

Let's ponder upon some simple but yet important questions: Who is my friend? Who is my family? How can we enrich each other's life? How can we grow together?

post_title: "'The Violin Conspiracy" by Brendan Slocumb: Reflections
message:
“I have seen their ways, but I will heal them. I will guide them and reward them with comfort. And for those who mourn, I will create a reason for praise: utter prosperity to those far and near, and I will heal them, says the Lord.”

(Isaiah 57:18-19)

The Violin Conspiracy sounds like a thriller:  Ray McMillian is determined to pursue a career as a violinist, despite all the obstacles the classical music world puts in his way as a Black man. After discovering his great-grandfather’s fiddle is actually an authentic Stradivarius, Ray’s dreams suddenly seem reachable. But then the violin is stolen, and Ray is determined to get it back. 

In spite of the fun of playing detective as I followed the storyline, what interested me the most was the inspiration for life that I got from it. 

Power of one 
Ray got little support for pursuing his musical aspirations. Even his mother discouraged him and insisted that he was wasting his time. However, the encouragement that he got from his grandmother and the fiddle from his great-grandfather that she gave him made all the difference in the world for him. 

Refuse to give in
Ray faced prejudice and ignorance like “black musicians can’t play classical music", and " black musicians can only play jazz.” Regardless, these insults did not stop him from pursuing his dreams. 

Give it all 
Ray coupled his passion for playing the violin with persistent hard work. He spent hours and hours practicing. He took lessons. He studied music. He put his head down and worked, not expecting any favors from anybody.

When passing through a tunnel in our life, it is easy for us to be flooded with the negativity in and around us. Let's count on our cheerleaders, self-empowerment, and most of all, God's graciousness, which takes us out of darkness into light.

There are so many things you can do. Ask yourself what you can do best.

- John Bon Jovi in CBC interview November 15th, 2022.

"I'd Rather Be Me" is the name of a song from the show Means Girls, which vividly portrays issues around coming of age. I have long passed that interesting stage of life. However, the message of this song transcends our age: Make deliberate attempts to discover the beauty in us, around us and embrace them with open arms each day.

Who is a rock? Only our God. 

(Psalm 18: 31)

In reminiscing, we can easily fall into the trap of idealizing a certain experience, object, or individual, to the point of idolizing them in a self-sabotaging manner.

Time for proactive actions?

Stat Can said that the percentage of Canadians who are seniors grows steadily from 14.1%, to 19% and then 22.5% between 2010, 2022, and 2030 respectively.

These figures remind me of the importance of a multi-generational mindset. In other words, we all need to pitch in to run the society, and not put sole responsibility on the next or next next generation to take care of the older ones. This can be a small deed like greeting a stranger with "good morning" and a smile, or big deeds such as treating volunteer work like a post-retirement new career.

Next time, when my children say, " You are not too old to learn", I will roll up my sleeves with a grin:)

I don't usually like to talk about controversial subject matters, but this time I do, out of the sheer wish to share my excitement with you my friends: 

* show appreciation for the act of kindness regardless of one's own preference, 
* take the 5th vaccine,
* and aboveall, observe a Christian life style embedded in faith, hope and love.

Frowned upon...

Be part of the solution. 

When? Today. Right Now!

post_title: A New Script for Dealing with Disappointments
message:
You need something.
Your request for help has been rejected.

You can choose to host a pity party. Or...

You can take a deep breath.
Put your own needs aside.
Step into others' shoes.
Send your most sincere and heartwarming wish to them. 

You may be nicely surprised about the outcome of this approach.

I used to admire your green thumb and your gigantic garden that always has bloomimg trees and flowers that give a warm greeting to each of the seasons, until I realized that I am just as privileged as you are. My father takes good care of his garden and owns a lot of land.

Who is my father?  Father God:)

Three of us walking together, two of them are my mentors.

三人行，必有我師。

post_title: Thanksgiving Prayer for You, Precious Family and Friends
message:
Walk, rest, strike a balance, knowing that you are never battling on your own even when you feel that way. 

May you experience the gift of presence from our Lord Jesus, fellow hikers He put in your life, and you yourself.

post_title: A Special Thank You For This Thanksgiving
message:
People think that I am the one who is loving. What they don't know is that you are the one who should get the acknowledgement. You do not know the person well, and yet went out of your way supporting me to show love. 

When I thank God for the opportunity to love, I also thank Him for you.

Synergy?
Between creatures who are like minded? 
Between our friends Confucius and Socrates?

Stop waiting for your turn to enjoy the synergy. Your turn is now. Look around, smile, thank God for the person(s) right here, and create fond memories for each other. Someday, you will look back at this moment as " the good old days".

post_title: Words of Encouragement From a Wizard
message: You can feel sad that they are not here with you. However, you can recall their good nature, and remind yourself that they are probably applauding over the fulfillment of your shared passionate and long time prayer. Amen.

After Rain has visited the area for a morning, as much as I appreciate their gift of freshness in the air and water for our lovely natural habitats, I was so thrilled when Sun showed up, so that I could go for my Sunday afternoon walk. 

In the middle of my little walk, it started to drizzle, and the drops got bigger and bigger. I was anxious for my new Sunday best. I did not want it to be drenched and stained by Rain. 

I thought I was so smart when I turned my leisurely strolling into speed walking, and realized shortly after that no matter how fast I walk, for the fact that I was too far from any indoor venue, if I got wet, I got wet, and there was not much I could do about it. 

I then slowed down, hummed, immersed in my fun endeavor looking for the first signs of fall, as if there was no rain. 

Before I knew it, the drizzling stopped. Sun came out again, amiably helped to dry my Sunday best in an unassuming manner. I giggled all the way home like a spoiled kid:)

The host and his beautiful wife greeted us at the door of the newly renovated, contemporary style and well kept place, showed us key facilities and things to do within walking distance, and invited us to enjoy their welcome gift of fresh fruits and filtered water. 

The host whatsapped us once in a while asking if everything is okay. 

Close to the end of our stay, the host offered to give us a farewell gift, which is a complimentary ride to the airport. 

On the day of departure, on the way to the airport, the host did a detour, and took us through the riviera and major landmarks of the metropolitan area. 

He explained that he has a thriving business, and he deliberately provides service in a way that his customers would become his champions:)

post_title: A New Stage of Spiritual Practice
message:
Talk less to God and listen more to Him. 

Worship where I am at the moment.

Sounds mystical? Just apply familiar practice in communication and spending quality time with our loved ones to interfaces with God.

What do we get out of this? Clarity, strength, capacity to receive and give.

Some Chinese chums asked me about my Greek breakfast, and here's my reply. Please feel free to translate it into your preferred language. 這是一希臘式健康早餐： 一个超肥美的牛油果代替傳統的麵包，裹上芝麻般細碎的麵包糠，烘烤成耀目的金色，拱託着芬芳，怡人的各種地中海土產食材：   三文漁，發達芝士，太陽煎疍白。绝妙的是用各種蔬菜，花瓣，把整个早點装扮成活潑清麗的皇家蝴蝶隆重登場。在椰林美景，蝉聲一浪接一浪的園林餐厅進食，才不過欧羅几塊錢。最美的是有风趣的張姐和心愛的兒子共享這个难得一遇的時刻。深感神要我們努力生活，但也給我們安憩，重新得力的恩典。
Put the cell phone down, talk with the people at the table, count our blessings for the day, encourage each other, and wrap up the get together with a hearty cheers.

post_title: The Folklore Miniature Museum and the Caves
message:
Touring the Folklore Miniature Museum and the Caves, 
Pondering upon the wonders of God's work, and 
Ruminating about our humble existence in the universe.

但願人長久，千里共嬋娟。

Apart but yet close with each other.

God:  I want to give you one blessing, the ultimate blessing. Tell me what you want.

Person: That is a sweet but yet tough invitation. (Long silence, and then talking under their breath sheepishly) Please bless my loved ones with the capacity to acknowledge you as Lord of their life and spend each day accordingly. 

God: Deal. Take heart. You do what you have to do in serving and enjoying your days before me.

Person: (Sobbing and shedding happy tears, rising from their seat, starting to sing and dance in praise of our Lord Jesus.)

post_title: Agean Sea Buddies' Adventure: Real or Surreal?
message:
There is a most beautiful island by the Agean Sea. Two most most beautiful gals went there for an exploration. 

They got lost in the process, ran into persons who described themselves as lucky locals who own multiple properties throughout the island, and gave the gals directives to a scenic beach.

The two gals arrived at the beach, got very tired, napped under the private beach's straw umbrellas and on the linen cots, dreamed about the sweetest mangoes imported from Paris, the most tasty octopus from the area, as well as the laughters from a most festive beach party.

When the two gals woke up from their nap, they were nicely surprised that their experience was not a dream. 

It was a special blessing for the day from above. 

The end.

Hippocampus? Name of hotel? Which one? The one in Paros or Antiparos? Made a non refundable booking in a rush and wondered if I have booked the one in a different location than a family wedding? And...
Realized that everything is in good hands afterall. 

Lesson learnt: catastrophic thinking is sometimes good for risk management, but may not be totally helpful for enjoying tranquility in the Mediterranean.

Q. One day on the mountain =
1000 years in the rest of the world. 
Tip: simile on Shangri-la

Q. One day with the Lord is as a 1000 years and a 1000 years is as one day. 
Tip: Bible 2 Peter 3: 8,9
Soar like an eagle wherever you are. Enjoy your 6000 steps of the day.

No? Deal with things on my own.

Yes? God walks with me. I do my part, to the best of my ability. He knows best where to go exactly even when I do not.

"Talking to Canadians: A Memoir" is written by one of Canada's comedy giants Rick Mercer

Lesson 1. Facing disappointments

Mercer presented his high school theatre production that was written specifically for a St. John’s audience, and got no laughs at the Newfoundland and Labrador high school theatre festival in Gander, N.L. He learned early on the lesson of knowing his audience. Taking this experience with him for the rest of his life, he has most mercifully used it during his career “to avoid being Toronto-centric.”

The above story reminds me that we all learn and grow from our experiences. 

Lesson 2. When being belittled. 

Mercer shared the story of being told to “[p]lease leave the theatre” because he has “nothing to offer” by a critic. 

The above story reminds me about the importance of not giving into verbal abuse, and keep pressing forward in pursuing one's dreams and hopes.
A friendly visitor for Daisy when she feels disconnected.

Heart? How deep? How big? How many? What
do you see, hear, smell, feel? What title would you give to this image?

Can I invite you to unravel the richness, contentment and hope that this image brings? 

Good day!
Applaud at each stage of life.

Kid: I am so happy.
Parent: Do you know why?
Kid: Because of the beach and the things that we do here.
Parent: Yes indeed, but most of all, you chose to enjoy yourself while we are here.

post_title: The Rich Man's Folly in Ourselves
message:
A rich man’s wealth is his fortified city; it is like a high wall in his imagination.(Proverbs 18: 11) 

We may laugh at the rich man in the above quote. However, we may fall into the same trap he does, that is, in our imagination position something or someone as our high wall. 

The truth is that we may enjoy certain beautiful things and people. They are God's blessings for us, like a gorgeous mural on the wall, but they are not the high wall. God is. 

The gorgeous mural may be gone and against our wish. Nevertheless, the high wall continues to stand there tall and sturdy sheltering us. 

Relax!

Walking with friends? Fun!
Walking with spouse? Nice company!!
Walking on my own, alone but not lonely, for our triune God is with me yesterday, today, tomorrow and in eternity!!!

post_title: Big Lessons For a Small Person
message:
Isn't it annoying to have a fly navigating in my spotless clean kitchen (by my "high" standards)? I tried to swat it when it was napping. It fluttered its wings in obvious pain, flew away, and was no where to be found. 

Isn't it boring to drive without the sound system? I fiddled around with mine that has been dysfunctional for over a year. The music suddenly came on, playing my all time favorite inspirational singer Shania Twain's songs. 

Life can be fragile, but can be tough too. On a day like this, when I wonder where I am going, I need some encouragement, and this is it. Cheers!

post_title: More Food Stories: God Showed Up At Our Door
message:
After a heartwarming, fun and labour intensive day, we finally put leftover food in the microwave and got ready for a late supper. I murmured to myself, maybe we should eat better than this, but...I am too tired, and it would be great if someone can give us some healthy, fresh tasty homemade food.

The minute our dear friend the microwave used the ding sound to remind gently that our only food for supper, the leftover food, was ready , I heard another ring tone sound at the door. It is our neighbour, bringing us exactly what I prayed about and salivated over the sheer thought of it. She did this with no knowledge about my wish, and without prior notice.

When we said grace over supper this evening, the thanksgiving for both our lovely neighbor and our God bears an extra sweet meaning. Amen.
Food brings people to the table, and into each other's heart and soul. Praise the Lord.

post_title: "Tribhanga": Reflections on a Movie About Strained Mother-Daughter Relationships
message:
When there is a strained relationship between a mother and daughter dyad, it is so easy for us the bleeding hearts to wonder who has wronged whom, and what we can do to help right the relationship. 

This movie reminded me once again that the mother and daughter may both be survivors of abuse and harsh experiences. One or both of them may display behaviors that we find offensive, such as denial, being judgemental of each other, anger, and estrangement.

Guard ourselves against the danger of colonizing the mother-daughter dyad, that is, imposing our own values and solutions on them. 

Do not play God and presume that we always have the answer for everything. 

Thank God for giving us two ears and just one mouth. Amen.

They say that when you sprinkle perfume on other people, you will get a little bit of the aroma yourself. 

Let's learn to give and...receive.

post_title: Reflections on "Nowhere Girl" by Cheryl Diamond
message:
This is a memoir of Anne's journey in breaking free from abuse and manipulation. This memoir reminds me of a few precious souls who have a heart of gold but are trapped in cycles of relational trauma. I pray that each and everyone of them will eventually has the same chance as Anne did. 
Don't give up!

They say that you have difficulty about disappointments in life not when it first happens, but when the crisis is over, the crowd goes away, and everyone returns to their normal life.

As much as what they say above may be true, you are covered in grace: When you feel as if you are all by yourself, you discover that some people are still around, and pray for you even without you knowing. At that moment, you gain strength to move forward, one step at a time, one day at a time.

When I lost one of the two earrings in a pair, I felt as if the other earring has lost its function, tried to find a new pair of earrings that look like the old pair, until I realized that this attempt may not solve the problem. 

I decided to shift gear: enjoy my fond memories of events that involve the old pair of earrings, and accept the reality that nothing except God and love last until eternity.

Thank God for a basket of gifts: the gift of different seasons in all creations, the gift of reminiscence, and most of all, the gift of presence which frees me up to wake up every morning to a new and mission focused beginning.

When babies go through transitions, like bedtime, saying goodbye to loving parents who would always come back, they wail in spite of all kinds of soothing strategies.

These little ones taught me that transitions are certainly uncomfortable, but they won't kill us in spite of our worst fear. Better still, there are always invisible supports around without us knowing. Yes, these supports would not even doze off, let alone sleep.

Do things in the name of who cares, self compassion, I need to take care of my own ?
Tell white lies? 
Use the silence is consent card? 
Play dumb?
Take a holier, older, wiser than thou tone? 
Redirect them? 
Say it like it is but spice it up with faith, hope, and love? 

We don't know when is the last time we see the person, do what we can, take our last breath. 

Grateful to the individuals who have shown integrity, offered relentless caring support, shared nice surprises to cheer us up, and most of all, our God who shows up when humans cannot and in spite of their best efforts.

Thank you to each and everyone of you who are around nearby and afar mobilizing the if there is a will there is a way golden rule.

We are crying, not grief but grateful tears. Thank you for the lessons.

Buy a cake, a fancy one. Nice!

Make a cake, a simple one, not as nice looking, but express love in one's own way. 

Lessons learnt: money can help us to get tools for conveying our love, but time and "heartwork" are priceless. 

Have you received it, my dear?

What is family?
Those who breathe, laugh, cry and grow with us. 

Where is home? 
Where our ❤️ wakes up in the beginning of the day and rests at the end of it.

Retrieving in the sanctuary, reflecting on answered and unanswered prayers.

Me: Why do I bother bugging you, especially with things that I have been telling you for years? 
God: You do a lot of things on your own and with your loved ones repeatedly, and you never complained either. 
Me: I don't enjoy everything I do repeatedly, but I am very grateful for the way things work:  sounding boards, helping hands, celebrating milestones. You are the host and a big part of this. Gracias God.
Who is the angel from God in your life? Grateful!

Got robbed in a group tour by friendly fellow travellers a million years ago, and became guarded in similar situations. 

Got help from fellow travellers in a recent trip, interpreting, inviting this traveler to sit with them, and saying goodbye with well wishes without taking anything from them. 

Yes, continue to be careful but enjoy the blessing of connectedness.

Scene 1. Enjoying a show, eating Raman, touching base, 
Scene 2. Laughing over his first solid food with him, talking about the joy of mothering with her, 
Scene 3. Eating cuisines like grasshopper salad marinated in chili oil, daily fresh bread with house special black sesame oil and sea salt, sharing. 

Everyday can be Mother's Day when we spend time of different sorts with our loved ones. Let's encourage each other to foster this daily practice. 

Happy Mother's Day everyone and especially our sisters who have loved other people's children like their own. You know who you are. Abundant blessings.

年年難過年年過。天天靠主天天精彩。感。恩。

Every year looked like the toughest of its kind, but we survived it through the manna from above day by day. Alleluia!

A. What do you have? 
B. A nice car.
A. What do you have? 
B. A beautiful home.
A. What do you have? 
B. An amazing garden. 
A. What do you have?
B. Best favor of the one who gave me the opportunity to enjoy them all.

Come away to a deserted place all by yourselves and rest for a while. (Mark 6:31)

Retire, rejuvenate and return to the table serving!

post_title: Holy Week: Thoughts on Where I Was and Where I Am
message:
Going into the Holy Week, I keep thinking about my days of fasting and daily visits at the church, in my course of pursuing the meaning of life and spirituality. 

That was then and this is now: I refrain from my multiple priorities, spend time with God, reflect on Jesus' sacrificial anti- oppression actions, celebrate his victory, and the difference this makes for all of us, literally all of us, when we humble ourselves and accept this gift of victory. 

Cheers!

It is easy to say death is simply part of our journey until it knocks on the door, our door or a loved one's door. Let us be prepared for the darkness, hope and pray for strength and support to embrace the golden moments that come with it, and ...start each day with gratitude and synergy.
Agenda for the day: Do nothing. Best prescription ever!

Validate our grief, 
Honor our graceful experience, 
Celebrate the splendid souls who held space for us, and 
Move forward in faith, hope and love. 

“Forget the former things;
  do not dwell on the past.
See, I am doing a new thing!
   Now it springs up; do you not perceive it?
I am making a way in the wilderness
   and streams in the wasteland." (Isaiah 43: 18, 19)

Another ordinary but sweet Sunday
... sharing sistering moments in spite of the freezing cold on the trail, 
...enjoying the contagious laughs from loved ones online, 
... witnessing recovery and hope dancing in our little haven!

Legacy from this snowstorm of the century? A hidden hero our neighbor Billy. Once again, he cleared the snow in the driveway for us quietly, out of his initiation, and not expecting anything in return. Billy is not necessarily young and mighty. The difference between Billy and us is that he has someone in the family who now enjoys full recovery from a health care issue, and we have someone going through the process. Cheers to Billy!
The Lord will guide you always. (Isaiah 58: 11)

Make a living AND 
Make a life:)

For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat,
I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink,
I was a stranger and you invited me in,
I needed clothes and you clothed me,
I was sick and you looked after me,
I was in prison and you came to visit me. …
Whatever you did for one of the least of these
brothers and sisters of mine, you did for me.
—Matthew 25:35-36, 40 (NIV)

Thank you for being around as we walk through the valley of darkness, my God and angels, who are each and everyone of you, my precious family and friends!

post_title: Being Grateful About Leaving It Better Than We Found It
message: Continue to take our share in making this a better world, but also make time to look up, wear our most beautiful smile, and whisper thank you...

post_title: Reflections on "You Are Awesome" by Neil Pasricha
message:
1. Resilience: 

My current relationship with resilience is a lot of fun. We support each other going through every day, with its blessings and blockages.

My most resilient role model is my own mom, who is exactly like the author’s mom. She has gone through the world wars, global depression, politics at work and in the family, bankruptcy, and finally her own chronic illness. She surely has been beaten down a lot, but she got up stronger every time, and left the best legacy ever for her children and the generations to come.

2. The magic word "yet": 

I have lived this motto “God is not finished with me yet.” It helps me to push forward in spite of dark moments in my life when I felt as if I have lost my directions, and my dreams and hopes have come to an end. It has also encouraged me to let the higher power carry my burdens when I cannot in spite of my best efforts.

3. Letting go of imposter syndrome: 

Some of us are struggling with imposter syndrome. The "losing more to win" principle can really help us to realize that it is okay to accept the fact that we can fail, failure is not the end of the world, we do not have to put undue pressure on ourselves to be the “winner” in all endeavors. When we have already been beaten up by a lot of people in our life journey, the last thing we want to do is to join the circle of oppressors, and push ourselves over the cliff by the vicious and most destructive weapon called “self doubt”. Yes, we can use our failure as fuel for lighting the fire that takes us out of the darkness. 

Winter is beautiful, let's treat it with full hospitality, with the knowledge that it is not going to last, and ... we need to survive it in order to enjoy the next season in our life.

post_title: Thank You For Taking My Hand
message:
They say: When you provide support, ask the individual to take your hand, not give you their hand. 
I say: How can I help you?

Thank you to everyone who has taken my helping hand and invited me to be on your team. You are a hero for giving yourself a new beginning. 

May you receive the best gift ever this holiday season: The tools for weaving your dreams and hopes, and breathing and living in them when the time comes!

[Most] blessed is the man who believes in, trusts in, and relies on the Lord, and whose hope and confidence the Lord is. 
—Jeremiah 17:7

This is like knowing that we have to go somewhere, whether we like it or not. We asked our lovely friends and family to pray for us and for advice, got over our ambivalence, booked the flight, did the rest of the zillion things on the list, and realized that it is time to go. What is "this"? T's treatment for a medical condition. We can go into it with all kinds of negative emotions, but we were inspired to practice our faith, and learnt to deal with it with a positive mind set. Going from a mindset of "T will fight this"  to " We will fight it with you T", all the way to " He (our Lord Jesus) will fight it" has not been an easy ride. Nevertheless, metaphorically, T has arrived at the airport, getting ready to launch his trip as he starts treatment tomorrow. Praise the Lord and thank you to each and everyone of you who have been our angels sharing gifts of different kinds to help T and the family--- and you know who you are !

As social distancing prolongs, I have fallen in love with videoconferencing as a way to sustain contacts. However, I have also wondered if there is an app that would allow me to enjoy and connect with the amazing people on the screen when I want or need to take a break from talking to each other. 

I think I got the answer to my own question this morning: The app called SILENCE. I and a lot of us are pros for engaging in activities in silence with our loved ones, spending time together hiking, eating, doing "cleaning party" on a Saturday, and without a word.
